feed.title: Current Watches, Warnings and Advisories for the United States Issued by the National Weather Service

entry.title: Special Weather Statement issued October 13 at 6:13AM AKDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...PERIODS OF HEAVY RAIN CONTINUING INTO FRIDAY MORNING... A LOW PRESSURE SYSTEM OVER THE EASTERN GULF OF ALASKA WILL CONTINUE TO MOVE NORTHWEST ALONG THE COAST THROUGH EARLY FRIDAY. PRECIPITATION AMOUNTS ACROSS THE REGION SO FAR HAVE BEEN AROUND 1.5 INCHES. PERIODS OF HEAVY RAIN WILL CONTINUE TO MOVE OVER THE AREA THIS MORNING WITH AN ADDITIONAL 0.5 TO 1.5 INCHES. THE LATEST SATELLITE
entry.cap:areaDesc: Admiralty Island; Cape Fairweather to Lisianski Strait; City and Borough of Juneau; City and Borough of Sitka; City and Borough of Yakutat; Eastern Chichagof Island; Glacier Bay

entry.title: Flood Warning issued October 13 at 9:41AM EDT until further notice by NWS
entry.summary: ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Florida... entry.title: Special Weather Statement issued October 13 at 10:25AM CDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...Strong Northwest Winds Today... Although these counties along the Highway 81 corridor are not currently included in a formal High Wind Warning given that speeds are expected to fall short of official criteria, it will still be quite windy today, with sustained northwest winds commonly 25 to 35 MPH and frequent gusts of 40 to 50 MPH.
